result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K. Matke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Brian K. Matke in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF192, 15CF432, 16CF8, 15TR3476, 15TR3477
1:32 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF8 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF192 - NO CONTEST


Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF8 Count 1, 15CF192.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
The following are dismissed and read-in: 16CF8 Counts 2, 3 & 4, 15CF432, 15TR3476, 15TR3477

Court questions the defendant further re: prior convictions. 
Defendant admits this is his 9th OWI offense. 

BY THE COURT: 

Court orders PSI. 

Atty Knaapen asks to revoke the defendant's bond. 
Court questions Atty Drengler. 
Atty Drengler makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond is revoked.

filed by ADA DK
Pre-trial conference at 02-01-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Brian K. Matke in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
3:46 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued

State files Information.
Defendant's atty received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing at 01-04-2016 03:00 pm
$2,000 sig bond: Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF192.

2:07 p.m. Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Wiave time limits.
BTC: $2,000 sig bond: Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF192.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
